channel.title: Blue Dot Not Appearing Since Site Ported
channel.description: Since the site was ported this week, I've noticed that the blue "unread" dots don't appear in the posts anymore. This includes posts made since the port. Hopefully this can be fixed?

item.title: Blue Dot Not Appearing Since Site Ported
item.dc:creator: @Christo
item.description:
@Christo wrote:

Thanks for doing the research. So strange: I could have sworn it did it in mobile.

Read full topic

item.title: Blue Dot Not Appearing Since Site Ported
item.dc:creator: @dominik
item.description:
@dominik wrote:

For reference desktop:

github.com

discourse/discourse/blob/397852a9a62d9caef4e6afde11a6e58a7ddbf908/app/assets/stylesheets/desktop/topic-post.scss#L820

    

  1. }
    2. 

  2. 

    3. 

  3. span.highlighted {
    4. 

  4.   background-color: $tertiary-low;
    5. 

  5. }
    6. 

  6. 

    7. 

  7. .first.new-user:not(.staff) a {
    8. 

  8.   color: $primary-low-mid;
    9. 

  9. }
    10. 

  10. 

    11. 

  11. .read-state {
    12. 

  12.   position: absolute;
    13. 

  13.   // We use absolute positioning here because we want it to display in the padding
    14. 

  14.   align-self: center;
    15. 

  15.   color: $tertiary-medium;
    16. 

  16.   right: 0;
    17. 

  17.   font-size: 0.571em;
    18. 

  18. }
    19. 

  19. 

    20. 

  20. .read-state.read {
    21. 

  21.   visibility: hidden;
    22.

and mobile:

github.com

discourse/discourse/blob/397852a9a62d9caef4e6afde11a6e58a7ddbf908/app/assets/stylesheets/mobile/topic-post.scss#L463

    

  1. .username.new-user a {
    2. 

  2.   color: $primary-low-mid;
    3. 

  3. }
    4. 

  4. 

    5. 

  5. .user-title {
    6. 

  6.   color: $primary-medium;
    7. 

  7.   overflow: hidden;
    8. 

  8.   margin-right: 50px;
    9. 

  9. }
    10. 

  10. 

    11. 

  11. .read-state {
    12. 

  12.   display: none;
    13. 

  13. }
    14. 

  14. 

    15. 

  15. .signup-cta {
    16. 

  16.   margin-left: auto;
    17. 

  17.   margin-right: auto;
    18. 

  18.   width: calc(100% - 50px);
    19. 

  19.   a {
    20. 

  20.     margin-top: 7px;
    21. 

  21.   }
    22.

Based on the code history it’s been like this at least since July 2014.

Read full topic
item.source: Blue Dot Not Appearing Since Site Ported

item.title: Blue Dot Not Appearing Since Site Ported
item.dc:creator: @dominik
item.description:
@dominik wrote:

So I checked and mobile gets a different stylesheet than desktop. Desktop has .read-state class visible (and color set to blue with SVG circle inside), mobile doesn’t. That’s why you’re not seeing it on mobile. I don’t have tablet to test it on so I don’t know what styles are loaded there but it’s probably desktop, that’s why you see blue dot there. It’s not resolution dependent as developer tools on desktop with low res emulation still get desktop stylesheets served. Site owners can probably overwrite it but given how tight everything is on mobile, I don’t think there’s space for that.

Read full topic
item.source: Blue Dot Not Appearing Since Site Ported

Read full topic
item.source: Blue Dot Not Appearing Since Site Ported

item.title: Blue Dot Not Appearing Since Site Ported
item.dc:creator: @Robert
item.description:
@Robert wrote:

Interesting… out of curiosity, I also tried checking a few other Discourse-powered forums (Waypoint, Discourse Meta) and I’m not seeing any blue dots for unread posts there either. I can’t be sure as to the version of the forum software those sites are running, but we’re currently on the latest version as we did upgrade as part of the migration.

I’ll keep looking into this and maybe see if I can restore locally on an older version to see if it’s a hidden change in the newest build.

Read full topic

item.title: Blue Dot Not Appearing Since Site Ported
item.dc:creator: @Christo
item.description:
@Christo wrote:

No, Sabine, not that kind of blue dot. I mean once you’ve clicked a topic it used to show the blue dots near the timestamp (e.g. 6d) to indicate ‘hey, you haven’t read this reply to the topic yet.’ Then while the dot is on your screen it will gradually fade because you have had the reply on your screen long enough to read it.

Screenshot_20191112-154132970×2048 445 KB

Read full topic
